intro: Tarenna attenuata, commonly known as the slender tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, white to pinkish flowers are borne in clusters and are followed by small, round berries. Tarenna attenuata is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest understory.
